alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 23 at 10:24AM CDT until September 23 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Harrison County in southwestern Iowa... Southern Burt County in east central Nebraska... Washington County in east central Nebraska... * Until 1115 AM CDT. * At 1024 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles southeast of Uehling, or 12 miles southwest of Tekamah, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Blair, Mondamin, Kennard, and Herman. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 86 and 89. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
